posts.post_content:
**Nearly every card in *Time Spiral* block was a throwback to at least one previously printed card.**  
  
This card references [Library of Alexandria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Library of Alexandria) and is part of the "Magus" super cycle of rare creatures. The cards in *Planar Chaos* all reference one of the most powerful lands ever; the others are [Magus of the Bazaar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Bazaar), [Magus of the Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Magus of the Coffers), [Magus of the Tabernacle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Tabernacle), and [Magus of the Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Arena).   
  
The *Time Spiral* part of the cycle focuses on powerful artifacts: [Magus of the Candelabra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Candelabra), [Magus of the Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Disk), [Magus of the Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Mirror), [Magus of the Jar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Jar), and [Magus of the Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Scroll). The *Future Sight* part of the cycle focuses on powerful enchantments: [Magus of the Moat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Moat), [Magus of the Future](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Future), [Magus of the Abyss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Magus of the Abyss), autoc... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Tynansdtm (7/5/2013 12:50:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Though people always discuss whether the transition to creature helps or not, there's one important thing here - this guy is a WIZARD.  
  
What do wizards do best? Draw Cards. You can build a Wizard Tribal deck based around card draw and this little guy fits in perfectly. Plus, mana ramp when you can't do the card draw. That's a deal in my book. And Simic just made Blue/Green Wizards even more viable.
posts.html:

Posted By: ParishInquisitor (2/19/2013 3:15:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This cards suits green just fine. Here are a couple more points to support his greenness. He is a magus of a land. If any color has lands as part of its flavor it is green. Ya, there is [Magus of the Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Coffers), but [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers) produces black mana so it's pretty safe to align it with a black creature. Also, this magus taps for mana, what's the primary color for mana dorks? Ah yes, green. Yeah, I know a two drop mana dork isn't the greatest, but I have a feeling this guy would have become a little too good as a one drop. Well that's my two cents on this card.

Posted By: FirstPrime (11/21/2012 7:12:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The deal with the colour probably came down to the fact that they printed 3 Magus per colour.   
  
They could've printed it in blue (in fact, they should've flavourfully), but look at the other Magus: would've [Magus of the Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Coffers) been useful in Green? Is [Magus of the Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Scroll)'s really Green? Wouldn't it have been rigged to finally have a green boardwipe with [Magus of the Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Disk)?  
  
I think it was a smart idea to make this Green. However, like ElMikkino said, I would've rather this be a [Sylvan Library](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Library).
posts.html:
The deal with the colour probably came down to the fact that they printed 3 Magus per colour.

They could've printed it in blue (in fact, they should've flavourfully), but look at the other Magus: would've Magus of the Coffers been useful in Green? Is Magus of the Scroll's really Green? Wouldn't it have been rigged to finally have a green boardwipe with Magus of the Disk?

I think it was a smart idea to make this Green. However, like ElMikkino said, I would've rather this be a Sylvan Library.

Posted By: Ferlord (10/6/2012 10:52:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He is probably green because the 'wisdom' mechanic of keeping a large hand is actually green's thing. (See: [Maro](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maro), [Inner Calm, Outer Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inner Calm, Outer Strength)) So he kind of makes perfect sense.  
  
Probably the hardest hit in the transition to magus (But not the worst magus) because by the time you can play ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) It'll be a little bit harder to get his ability off, but lets look at some pluses here!  
  
First, he is a 1/1 body and taps for mana in a pinch, not bad. Obviously, he also doesn't take the land drop for the turn like his big brother [Library of Alexandria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Library of Alexandria). There are still ways to get to seven cards, like a [Wheel of Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel of Fortune), his best bud [Magus of the Jar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Jar) (and [Memory jar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memory jar)) or a [Diminishing Returns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diminishing Returns).Also green cards that can search for multiple lands or anything with the splice or forecast mechanics can help here.
posts.html:
He is probably green because the 'wisdom' mechanic of keeping a large hand is actually green's thing. (See: Maro, Inner Calm, Outer Strength) So he kind of makes perfect sense.

Probably the hardest hit in the transition to magus (But not the worst magus) because by the time you can play It'll be a little bit harder to get his ability off, but lets look at some pluses here!

First, he is a 1/1 body and taps for mana in a pinch, not bad. Obviously, he also doesn't take the land drop for the turn like his big brother Library of Alexandria. There are still ways to get to seven cards, like a Wheel of Fortune, his best bud Magus of the Jar (and Memory jar) or a Diminishing Returns.Also green cards that can search for multiple lands or anything with the splice or forecast mechanics can help here.

posts.post_content:
For some reason I see Libraries as more Green and White than Blue. I think of Blue as hoarding the knowledge to himself in his own personal musty Tome. Maybe this is just because I can't help but think of Rivendell as a famous Elvish Library, which must be White-Green.   
This combos rather nicely with Magus of the Jar, if I do say so myself.
